p: Because body size is often correlated with mammals extinction risk, we included body mass as a variable to account for random effects in all our GLMMs to avoid biased results [ 38, 40]. Body mass data was obtained from the dataset available in [ 41], which is largely based on the PanTHERIA dataset [ 42]. ΔRange, ΔSuitability and body mass were log-transformed. Later we converted body mass into a categorical variable by rounding the log-transformed values. This process generated 15 distinct categories, ranging from the smallest (weighting between 1.77 and 4.44g) to the largest mammals (2285.94 to 3824.54kg).
